artefact.overview: You need to register with the Scottish Ministers to operate an egg packing centre in Scotland
artefact.licence_short_description: Register with the Scottish Ministers to operate an egg packing centre in Scotland.
artefact.licence_overview:
If you operate an egg packing centre in Scotland, you must be registered with the Scottish Ministers. You should contact the [Scottish Government's Egg Marketing Inspectorate])(http://www.sears.scotland.gov.uk/ViewService.aspx?id=207 "Scottish Government's Egg Marketing Inspectorate"){:rel="external"} for registration.

To qualify for registration, your premises must have:

- suitable candling equipment continuously staffed to allow the quality of each egg to be examined separately
- a device for measuring the air cell
- a machine for grading eggs by weight
- one or more approved balances for weighing eggs
- equipment for marking eggs with a producer code

Authorisation will be granted providing your equipment is of the required standard.

Your premises must be approved separately as a food business by your local authority before you can start trading.

Failure to comply with this requirement may result in a fine.
